block.p: Around Town
Museums and Sites

AMERICAN MUSEUM OF NATURAL HISTORY Central Park West and 79th Street. Through Jan. 6, ''Mythic Creatures: Dragons, Unicorns & Mermaids.'' Through April 6, 2008, ''Beyond,'' an exhibition of more than 30 large-format photographs of Earth's planetary neighbors, in the museum's Imax Gallery. Through Jan. 6, ''The Unknown Audubons: Mammals of North America,'' a display of more than 40 artworks depicting animals. In the Imax theater, ''Dinosaurs Alive!,'' a film about museum paleontologists in search of dinosaur remains. Timed tickets to ''Mythic Creatures'' and ''Gold'' include museum admission. (212) 769-5100 or (212) 769-5200; $21; $16 for students and 60+; $12 for 12 and younger. Imax movie tickets, which include museum admission, are $21; $16 for students and 60+; $12 for children 12 and under. Suggested museum admission: $14; $10.50 for students and 60+; children, $8. Combination tickets, including museum and Rose Center admission and the Hayden Planetarium space show (''Cosmic Collisions''): $22; $16.50 for students and 60+; $13 for 12 and younger; under 2, free. Admission that includes all activities: $30; $23 for students and 60+; $19 for 12 and younger. Museum hours: daily, 10 a.m. to 5:45 p.m. (to 8:45 p.m. on Fridays). amnh.org.

MUSEUM OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK, Fifth Avenue at 103rd Street. Today at 2 p.m., an art walk through El Barrio; $9, $5 for students, 62+ and members. Tuesday, from 6 to 9 p.m., the museum will be open for the Museum Mile Festival, featuring free admission and events at participating museums from 82nd to 105th Streets. Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. (212) 534-1672. Suggested admission: $9; $5 for students and 62+; free for children under 12; $20 for families; free on Sundays, 10 a.m. to noon. mcny.org.
Gardens

BROOKLYN BOTANIC GARDEN, 1000 Washington Avenue, Prospect Heights Through June 30, ''June Is Rose Month,'' with thousands of blooming varieties and special events. Tuesdays through Fridays, 8 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Saturdays, Sundays and holidays (except Labor Day), 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. (718) 623-7200. $8; $4 for students and 65+; free for under 12 and members at all times and for 65+ on Fridays. Free admission all day on Tuesdays and Saturdays, 10 a.m. to noon. bbg.org.

NEW YORK BOTANICAL GARDEN, Southern Boulevard and 200th Street, Bedford Park, the Bronx. Rose Month, with activities tomorrow and Sunday. Through Sept. 16, ''Caribbean Gardens: Journey to Paradise,'' a conservatory display. Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Tram tours daily, every 20 minutes. (718) 817-8700. Combination ticket, which includes admission for all displays, garden sites, tours, tram tours and events: $18; students and 62+, $16; children 2 to 13, $5; free for children under 2. General garden grounds admission: $6; $3 for 62+; $2 for students; $1 for children 2 to 12; free for children under 2. Conservatory admission: $5; $4 for students and 62+; $3 for children 2 to 12; free for children under 2. Grounds admission free on Wednesdays and 10 a.m. to noon on Saturdays. Parking, $10; nybg.org.
Events

ARTWALK 07 Atlantic Avenue, from Fourth Avenue to Hicks Street, Brooklyn. Free open-studio visits, exhibitions and other events. Tomorrow and Sunday, 1 to 6 p.m. Sponsors include COlab Projects and the Atlantic Avenue Local Development Corporation. artwalk07.com.
BIG APPLE BARBECUE FESTIVAL, Madison Avenue, from 23rd to 25th Street and Madison Square Park. Tomorrow and Sunday, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.

18th MOUNT MORRIS PARK HOME TOUR, Sunday at 11 a.m., meeting at the Pelham Fritz Center in Marcus Garvey Park, Mount Morris Park West and 122nd Street. harlemmtmorris.org. $25 in advance, $30 on Sunday, $40, includes a reception.
HARE KRISHNA PARADE, Fifth Avenue, from 59th Street to Washington Square Park, Manhattan. Tomorrow, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.

HISTORIC JACKSON HEIGHTS WEEKEND Community United Methodist Church, 81-10 35th Avenue, Queens. Featuring free slide lectures on the history of the area (tomorrow at 10:45 a.m. and 12:15 p.m.) and garden tours (self-guided, tomorrow at noon; and escorted, Sunday at noon). Sponsored by the Jackson Heights Beautification Group. (718) 565-5344. $10 for each tour, $15 for both.
LENOX HILL NEIGHBORHOOD HOUSE, First Avenue, between 68th and 79th Streets. Tomorrow, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.

OCEAN LINER BAZAAR Tomorrow, 10 a.m. to 2 p.m., with ship models, paintings, prints, china and other memorabilia, at the Abigail Adams Smith Auditorium, 417 East 61st Street, Manhattan. (917) 777-4344. $5.
116TH STREET FESTIVAL, between Second and Lexington Avenues and Third Avenue, from 106th to 122nd Streets. Tomorrow, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.
PUERTO RICAN DAY PARADE AND FESTIVAL, Fifth Avenue, between 44th and 86th Streets. Sunday, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.
STUYVESANT PARK NEIGHBORHOOD ASSOCIATION STREET FAIR, Second Avenue, from 14th to 23rd Street, Manhattan. Tomorrow, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.
TILDEN MIDTOWN DEMOCRATIC CLUB FESTIVAL, Third Avenue, between 23rd and 34th Streets, Manhattan. Sunday, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.
Spoken Word

POETRY WALK, Monday at 6:30 p.m. across the Brooklyn Bridge, site of a reading. The event, a fund-raiser for Poets House, culminates with a dinner at St. Ann's Warehouse; participants include the actors Bill Murray and Oliver Platt and the poet Galway Kinnell. Reservations: (212) 431-7920, Ext. 2211. $250 and up.
Walking Tours

ART TOUR OF THE SOUTH BRONX Sunday at 2 p.m., includes private studios and an exhibition, meeting in front of the subway station on the Grand Concourse, at 138th Street. Reservations: (212) 772-3483 or (845) 729-5467. $20.

BROOKLYN CENTER FOR THE URBAN ENVIRONMENT Tonight at 7:45, ''Bats in Brooklyn!,'' in search of the creatures in Prospect Park, meeting at the Tennis House, near the entrance at Ninth Street; participants should bring along flashlights. (718) 788-8500, Ext. 208. $13; members, $10; 62+ and students, $8.

BROOKLYN STREET NAMES Sunday at 1 p.m., covers the origins of street names in Brooklyn Heights, meeting at its sponsor, the Brooklyn Historical Society, Pierrepont and Clinton Streets. (718) 222-4111. Free.

CENTRAL PARK CONSERVANCY Free weekend tours of Central Park. Tomorrow at noon, ''Seneca Village'' covers one of the earliest communities of black American property owners, meeting at the southeast corner of Central Park West and 85th Street. Tomorrow at 1 p.m. ''The Castle and Its Kingdom'' meets at Belvedere Castle, midpark at 79th Street. centralparknyc.org.
CHINATOWN HISTORY AND TASTING TOUR Tomorrow and Sunday at 2 p.m., led by NYC Discovery Tours; reservations and meeting place: (212) 465-3331. $20, including food.

FORT WADSWORTH ON THE NARROWS, Sunday, 10:15 a.m. to 3 p.m., a walking, bus and ferry tour of this historic Staten Island military post, meeting at the top of the escalators at the Staten Island Ferry Terminal in Lower Manhattan. Sponsored by the Municipal Art Society. Reservations required: (212) 935-2075. $50, $40 for members.

GREEN-WOOD CEMETERY Tomorrow at 1 p.m., two tours of this historic Brooklyn cemetery, both meeting at the main entrance at Fifth Avenue and 25th Street. One is sponsored by the Green-Wood Historic Fund: (631) 549-4891; $10, $5 for members. The second, sponsored by Big Onion Walking Tours; (212) 439-1090; $15, $12 for 63+, $10 for students and members of the New-York Historical Society.

HARLEM, YOUR WAY! Sunday at 10:15 a.m., ''Experience the Beauty of Harlem Gospel'' with a stop at an art gallery and a gospel church service, meeting at 129 West 130th Street. An optional meal follows. (212) 690-1687. $25.
I'LL TAKE MANHATTAN TOURS Tomorrow at 1 p.m., ''TriBeCa, Yesterday and Today,'' meeting at the northwest corner of Vesey Street and Broadway. (732) 270-5277. $15.

IMMIGRANT TOURS in Lower Manhattan. Tomorrow at 11:45 a.m., Gotham Walk will lead a tour of the Lower East Side; meeting place, (212) 629-1886; $10. On Monday at 1 p.m., Big Onion Walking Tours will sponsor a walk through the Lower East Side, Chinatown, Little Italy and the former Five Points District, meeting on the southeast corner of Broadway and Chambers Street. (212) 439-1090. $15, $12 for 63+, $10 for students and members of the New-York Historical Society.

LIVING WHERE AMERICA WAS BORN, Sunday at 10:30 a.m., a tour of Lower Manhattan, with a look at its popularity as a residential area, meeting in front of Federal Hall, Wall and Broad Streets. Led by Hank's New York Tours. (646) 234-0997. Free.

METRO TOUR SERVICE Today through Sunday at 2 p.m., Brooklyn Heights, Fort Greene and Clinton Hill, Brooklyn, meeting in front of the Marriott Hotel, Adams and Tillary Streets, downtown Brooklyn. (718) 789-0430. $25.
OUTDOORS CLUB Sunday at 1 p.m., a walk through Clinton (Hell's Kitchen), meeting in fronting of McDonald's, Eighth Avenue and 56th Street. (212) 877-9623. $3.

SPANISH HARLEM SALSA TOUR Daily at 10 a.m. and 6 p.m., includes a lecture on the culture and history of the area, meeting at Fifth Avenue and 110th Street. Sponsored by the Lubona Corporation. Reservations: (212) 253-8702. $25.

'YORKVILLE: ONCE A SUBURB' Sunday at 2 p.m., with stops at Gracie Mansion, the Henderson Place Historic district and the Peter Pan statue, meeting on the northwest corner of 86th Street and Second Avenue. Sponsored by Bernie's New York. (718) 655-1883. $10.
Recreation

NEW YORK MINI 10K Tomorrow at 9 a.m. in Central Park, a race for girls and women only, 12 years and older, tomorrow at 9 a.m., beginning at Central Park West and 61st Street; check-in, 7:45 to 8:45 a.m., across from Tavern on the Green, West Drive at 67th Street. Sponsored by the New York Road Runners Club. (212) 860-4455. Advance registration fees, $30, $14 for 18 and younger and 62+. Race-day fees, $35, $25 and $14.

ROCK AND RUN ON THE RIVER Sunday, fund-raising runs and walks on the West Side, sponsored by Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center, beginning with a five-kilometer run at 9 and followed by a five-kilometer walk at 9:30 a.m. and post-race festivities from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m.; registration begins at 7:30 a.m. at Pier 26, West Side Highway and Charles Street. (646) 227-3885, mskcc.org. $30 registration fee.
Around Town

Recreation

NEW YORK MINI 10K Tomorrow at 9 a.m. in Central Park, a race for girls and women only, 12 years and older, tomorrow at 9 a.m., beginning at Central Park West and 61st Street; check-in, 7:45 to 8:45 a.m., across from Tavern on the Green, West Drive at 67th Street. Sponsored by the New York Road Runners Club. (212) 860-4455. Advance registration fees, $30, $14 for 18 and younger and 62+. Race-day fees, $35, $25 and $14.

(646) 227-3885, mskcc.org. $30 registration fee.
